concise_definition: n. 便宜货, 优惠交易, 协议

definitions.explanation_en: A purchase or deal in which goods or services are obtained at a significantly lower price than usual, offering excellent value for money.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以远低于通常价格购得的商品或服务，具有极高的性价比。
definitions.example_en: She scored some amazing bargains at the weekend flea market.
definitions.example_cn: 她在周末的跳蚤市场上淘到了几件超值的便宜货。

definitions.explanation_en: An agreement or arrangement, especially one reached after negotiation, often involving compromise between parties.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指经过协商达成的协议或安排，通常涉及双方的妥协。
definitions.example_en: The union and management reached a bargain on wages and working conditions.
definitions.example_cn: 工会与管理层就工资和工作条件达成了协议。

definitions.explanation_en: Something considered to be of great benefit or advantage, often used figuratively to describe a favorable outcome or opportunity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 比喻性地指某种极有利的收获或机会，常用于形容超出预期的收益。
definitions.example_en: Getting this job was a real bargain — I learned so much in just three months.
definitions.example_cn: 得到这份工作真是物超所值——我在短短三个月内学到了很多。

comparison.analysis: “Deal” (交易) 是一个更宽泛的词，泛指任何协议或商业安排，不必然包含价格优势。它可以是公平交易，也可以是不利的交易。而 “bargain” 特指对买方有利、价格低廉的交易，强调性价比。
“Discount” (折扣) 指价格的直接减少，是一个具体的数值或百分比，是实现 “bargain” 的一种手段。但并非所有折扣都构成 bargain —— 如果原价虚高，折扣后仍不便宜。而 “bargain” 强调最终结果的优越性，而非过程。
“Steal” (天价便宜货) 是口语中对 bargain 的夸张表达，强调价格低到不可思议，仿佛‘白拿’。它比 bargain 更具情感色彩和戏剧性，常用于促销语境，如 ‘This coat is a steal at $20!’。两者语义接近，但 ‘steal’ 更强烈、更非正式。
